TestCase.author: Noname
TestCase.Description: Sample of a basic Workflow Map test

Request.Comments:
Create a new Workflow Map Go to Administration/Workflow Maps and create a new workflow. Enter a name for the workflow map Insert a new Activity along a path (select the path from the Start activity to the End, click RMB/Insert Activity to add a new activity). Enter Activity's name (example: TestActivity). Enter an Expected Duration, Timeout Duration, Reminder Interval and Reminder Count. Specify an Escalate to identity.
Go to Assignments tab and add Innovator Admin identity (its Voting Weight is 100) to it. Highlight the new path from the new Activity to the End (currently named [none]) and specify a name.
Save the Workflow Map. Confirm that all of added data are saved successfully Attach created workflow map to some ItemType Edit some existing or create a new ItemType. Go to Workflows tab, add the created workflow map there, set it as default Save/Unlock and Close the item type
Create a new instance of the ItemType Select the Item Type in TOC. Create a new item of it. Save/Unlock and Close

In Basket Go to MyInnovator/InBasket. Check Workflow Activities and Active checkboxes. Confirm that 'TestActivity' activity appears in the list of Activities. Locate the instance in the List of Activities. Click “Open the Attached Item” icon on main toolbar. Confirm that the window is opened for the item associated with the Workflow Process. Click “View the Workflow Process” icon on main toolbar. Confirm that the opened window shows the started Workflow Process. Press “View Sign-Offs” button and confirm that the opened window has Workflow History Report. Click “Update the Activity” icon on main toolbar. Confirm that the Workflow Voting Dialog is opened. Enter comments and click Save Changes. Confirm that the activity assignment does not disappear from the InBasket. Click “Update the Activity” icon again and confirm that the saved changes are shown in the Workflow Voting Dialog.

Confirm that "TestActivity" activity no longer appears in the InBasket. In Basket Go to MyInnovator/InBasket. Check Workflow Activities and Active checkboxes. Confirm that 'TestActivity' activity appears in the list of Activities. Locate the instance in the List of Activities. Click “Open the Attached Item” icon on main toolbar. Confirm that the window is opened for the item associated with the Workflow Process. Click “View the Workflow Process” icon on main toolbar. Confirm that the opened window shows the started Workflow Process. Press “View Sign-Offs” button and confirm that the opened window has Workflow History Report. Click “Update the Activity” icon on main toolbar. Confirm that the Workflow Voting Dialog is opened. Enter comments and click Save Changes. Confirm that the activity assignment does not disappear from the InBasket. Click “Update the Activity” icon again and confirm that the saved changes are shown in the Workflow Voting Dialog.

Create a new item of TestWorkflow item type Select Quality Innovator/TestWorkflow item type in main tree and create a new item (click 'Create a New Item' icon on main toolbar). Fill in 'prop_str' field (enter, for example, 'test_prop_str'). Save/Unlock and Close the item

Go to MyInnovator/InBasket. Check Workflow Activities, Active and Pending check boxes. Confirm that Activity1 has Active status, Activity2, Activity3 and Activity4 have Pending status. Confirm that automatic activities (Start, AutoActivity, End) do not appear in InBasket

Update 'Activity1'. Confirm that Tasks section is populated with tasks. Select the vote (to act2), mark all required tasks as complete, enter right Authentication. Confirm that activity can be completed successfully (click 'Complete' button). Confirm that "Activity1" no longer appears in the InBasket. Confirm that 'Activity2' has Active status now

Go to MyInnovator/InBasket. Check Workflow Activities, Active and Pending check boxes. Confirm that Activity1 has Active status, Activity2, Activity3 and Activity4 have Pending status. Confirm that automatic activities (Start, AutoActivity, End) do not appear in InBasket
Update 'Activity2'. Select 'Refuse' vote. Confirm that activity can be completed successfully (click 'Complete' button).
Confirm that activity doesn't disappear from the InBasket (Process Owner: Innovator Admin).
Confirm that activity doesn't disappear from the InBasket (Process Owner: Innovator Admin).

Update 'Activity3'. Confirm that Variables sections are populated with variables. Select 'Delegate' vote. Specify some identity to 'Delegate To' field (for example, 'Innovator Admin' identity). Confirm that activity can be completed successfully.
Confirm that activity doesn't disappear from the InBasket (Process Owner: Innovator Admin).
Confirm that activity doesn't disappear from the InBasket (Process Owner: Innovator Admin).
Confirm that "Activity4" activity no longer appears in the InBasket.
